Advance the buffered state, getting a new target.
TODO: change this to snapFrame and put after base call First Apply the previous targ, for end of interpolation application.
End of Interpolation triggers and Events Since we are interpolating, to line up timing of all networked objects The actual occurance of a frame is when it ARRIVES at target.
TODO: don't know if states act like triggers or params yet.

PopulateFrames() PopulateFramesPhoton.Pun.Simple.SyncAnimator Photon.Pun.Simple.SyncAnimatorPopulateFrames
override void Photon.Pun.Simple.SyncAnimator.PopulateFrames ( )[protected], [virtual]
Override this with frame initialization code.
The default base just creates the frame instances and assigns them index values.
Animator frames vary from usage to usage, so there is a pool for every instanceID.
Basic factory, just gives each frame an index.
Reimplemented from Photon.Pun.Simple.SyncObject< SyncAnimator.Frame >.
